resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
For both rhel7 and centos7 we need a new repository to be installed before users can install the console.

For rhel the repository name is 'rhel-7-server-extras-rpms', and can be enabled via the instructions here(although this page doesn't specifically describe the extras rpms, it describes how to install a repository via the redhat 'subscription-manager' command or via the more traditional 'yum-config-manager' command): https://access.redhat.com/solutions/265523

For centos7, it is enabled by default, as documented here: https://wiki.centos.org/AdditionalResources/Repositories

attachment.filename: Install enable extras repo pseudo content DRAFT.pdf

fields.summary: Document new 'extras' repository required on centos7/rhel7 for eucaconsole

comments.body: [~mbacchi] please see attached for pseudo doc content, where I think this will go. Am I on the right track? If not, please let me know. thanks.

[~kmeredith] I do understand that there will be reorganization of the install guide for 4.3.  Obviously due to that, section headings used today won't be 1:1 mappings to where this information needs to go in the 4.3 guide.  But here is where I envision it going in today's guide format:

1. These instructions would go in the section Console Guide -> Install the Eucalyptus Management Console  -> Install on Centos / RHEL 6.6 page (url: http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.1/#shared/console_install_centos_rhel6.html)

2. These instructions would also go in the section Installation Guide -> Install Repositories (url: http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.1/#install-guide/install_repos_intro.html)  But instead of just mentioning it as is done there with the EPEL repository today, it would list the actual commands as you have done in the attached PDF.  This way it would be shown to be a repository required IN ADDITION to the the EPEL repository.

Let me know if this needs further explanation.
Makes sense, [~mbacchi]. Was already targeting your #1 comment (but a new/updated section: RHEL 7 instead of 6.6). However, I did not get your #2 comment before now, so that is good to know. Thanks!

Actually, [~kmeredith] I just realized that I incorrectly identified the standard Eucalyptus installation guide as requiring this documentation.  It is only required in the Console Guide.

Please ignore step 2 in my above comment.

[~lincoln.thomas] you should be aware of these doc changes I'm making now. Feedback / answers welcome!

Added new topic:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_rhel7_extras_repo.html

Replaced RHEL6 topic with RHEL7 version (updated prereqs):
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_centos_rhel7.html

Still need to make changes to upgrade, but I believe you mentioned changes for this section:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_upgrade_console.html should include XREF to extras repo topic during upgrade, around steps 3 and 4.

[~mbacchi] please review or delegate. :) how can I verify that extras repo is installed and enabled - lack of a yum error? or?

[~lincoln.thomas] feel free to add upgrade-related notes.

[~kmeredith] These commands actually don't work, I just tested them on a RHEL 7 box and it isn't accurate.

I will come up with either a link to point people to with instructions, or provide instructions for inclusion in this page.

[~kmeredith], [~jhalterman]

I can't find an explicit document from Redhat describing the process to install the repository.  But this one is external, and has all methods that we would suggest: https://www.linuxunit.com/how-to-subscribe-to-rhel7-optional-channel/    We also need to specify that these instructions are for a different repository, and that we're requiring the rhel-7-server-extras-rpms repo.

Is this a valid external source to link to do you think?  If not we will have to include basically all of those possibilities in our docs, which I'd rather outsource.

Also, [~kmeredith] in all instances where you reference 'extras', I'd like to spell out the full name 'rhel-7-server-extras-rpms' so as not to confuse this with the EPEL repository which we also require(EPEL stands for 'Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux').  

Finally, the command to verify that they installed the repository properly is based on the process they used to install it(i.e. from the URL above), so there could be any array of commands they used to do this.  I don't think we need to provide a verification, because they can attempt installing the 'eucaconsole' package now and if it doens't complain that there are dependencies missing, and if it installs correctly, that's verification enough.

[~mbacchi] I believe you were going to point me to *one* of the methods to install rhel-7-server-extras-rpms ? (ping)
[~jhalterman] can you test this and give me the correct commands please? since i think [~mbacchi] has a lot on his plate

Changed the RHEL 'extras' references to 'rhel-7-server-extras-rpms' per Matt's request.
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_rhel7_extras_repo.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_centos_rhel7.html
[~kmeredith] For sure, will do.

[~mbacchi] Do you know if we have a RHEL subscription I can use to register a RHEL machine? I'm not able to verify the installation since packages / repos don't appear to be available unless the machine is registered (or maybe you know more about this).

[~kmeredith] I finally got a redhat network account so I could try this properly ([~mbacchi] let me know if you want the details). The install guide works fine, but one step appears unnecessary:

http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_rhel7_extras_repo.html

yum install rhel-7-server-extras-rpms

That step is not needed. The important bit is just enabling the extras repo with the config manager.

[~jhalterman] I agree, I didn't think that command was doing anything, so lets remove that [~kmeredith] (the yum install rhel-7-server-extras-rpms command)

Otherwise [~jhalterman] the instructions work?  You can install eucaconsole after doing that (from euca yum repo?)
[~mbacchi] Yep, the console installs and starts up fine!

Oh one other thing [~jhalterman], are you working on an RHEL machine from EQS (cobbler?)  If so the kickstart adds local (in SB) rhel mirrors that we have, so please make sure to remove those to prove that installing eucaconsole works when required to get dependencies from the actual rhel-7-server-extras-rpms repo, not our mirror.

Thanks a lot.
-Matt
[~mbacchi] Yea, I'm using an EQS reserved machine. Is it just the local exreas repo that needs to be disabled first?

Per Matt's suggestion to remove all of the local repos on an EQS machine before installing, I discovered that we also need to add the optionals repo in order to install eucaconsole:

yum-config-manager --enable rhel-7-server-optional-rpms

With that additional change, I was able to install on a clean machine with only the epel-7-x86_64, eucalyptus, rhel-7-server-extras-rpms and rhel-7-server-optional-rpms repos enabled. The console was installed and starts fine.
[~jhalterman] is this ready to come back in my queue now? Or do you still have more to do? thanks - [~mbacchi] too!
[~kmeredith] I think that [~mbacchi] may have been trying out this himself, but with the changes above I'm done with this for now. Maybe [~mbacchi] has something to add though...
This work is not yet finished.
[~kmeredith] Sorry, mistook this for my ticket.
Hey [~mbacchi] hope you can take a look at this today. thanks!

[~kmeredith] for now please just add the rhel-7-server-optional-rpms repo as [~jhalterman] has indicated.  I honestly haven't had time to look at this more and won't likely until later next week if even before the GA.  The worst case scenario is we remove the requirement later (for 4.3.1 or whatever.)  But badder outcomes if it really requires the optional repo and we don't document it...

Will appear in 8 PM doc build - 
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#shared/console_install_rhel7_extras_repo.html

Hey [~mbacchi] so of course going from 1 singular repo to 2 plural, words needed to change to go with. Also, if you go to that CentOS wiki link, don't see the 'optional' repo listed for CentOS. So it might be that CentOS users will need to install 1, and RHEL 7 users 2. 

Anyway, hope you do get to this before GA. But if not, we'll correct any of the "badder" (?!) issues when you find them. 

Also, since this is no longer a blocker. I'm downgrading this ticket. thanks.
This looks great [~kmeredith] thanks so much!
